alert.note: Alert for Hanover; Henrico; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 4:08PM EST until December 10 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties, Amelia, Chesterfield, Goochland, Hanover, Henrico and Powhatan. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 407 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen in the past 45 minutes. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area during the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Ashland, Moseley, Tuckahoe, Bon Air, Randolph Macon College, Manakin, Sabot, Wyndham, Chula, Laurel, Glen Allen, Scotts Fork, Holly Hills, Subletts, Midlothian, Flat Rock, Fine Creek Mills, Clayville and Skinquarter. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
